targets.expr: (java_lang_OperatingSystem_TotalPhysicalMemorySize{namespace="$namespace", service="$service", pod="$pod"} - java_lang_OperatingSystem_FreePhysicalMemorySize{namespace="$namespace", service="$service", pod="$pod"}) / java_lang_OperatingSystem_TotalPhysicalMemorySize{namespace="$namespace", service="$service", pod="$pod"}

(java_lang_OperatingSystem_TotalPhysicalMemorySize{namespace="$namespace", service="$service", pod="$pod"} - java_lang_OperatingSystem_FreePhysicalMemorySize{namespace="$namespace", service="$service", pod="$pod"}) / java_lang_OperatingSystem_TotalPhysicalMemorySize{namespace="$namespace", service="$service", pod="$pod"}

options.content:
### ℹ️ What does a -1 value mean ?
If you can see a maximum line constant and at -1, it means that the concerned resource is not limited

### 🔎 Detail of the memory pool graph

The 6 following graphs are the magnified version of each pool on the memory pool graph
